intro: Crotalaria platysepala, commonly known as the broad-sepal crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features erect stems with alternate, pinnately compound leaves. Its distinctive flowers are typically yellow with prominent violet or purple veins, and it produces capsule fruits that release seeds when mature. Crotalaria platysepala is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
